Reviews.Title: “Tamarindo Estates THE VIEW must be seen to be believed”
Reviews.Author: SuE0526
Reviews.Content: For the sixth year out of the last seven, we have rented two apartments at Tamarindo Estates during our children's spring break and would highly recommend it to those who value beautiful views, calm surroundings and the best (?!) snorkeling in the Caribbean. This year, the Tamarindo public beach nearby provided fantastic snorkeling with many, many turtles in various sizes, lots of stingrays and fantastic fishes in every possible size and color. The new caretakers were lovely and immediately provided whatever was needed. We often cook in our kitchen and enjoy the view from the terrace, the view has to be seen and I will look for a pic to post. We often think we should be trying a new place, but then in the fall our kids say: let's go back again. With the nearby Flamenco Beach, the drive to Zoni Beach, the usual dinner at Mamacita's and kayak rentals we might return again next year.As the kids will be off to college, we plan to invite my sister and brother in-law to join us instead. I can only think of one thing that could possibly be improved at this wonderful place; having wider beds, the nightstands should be tossed out and queen beds added. And with a new Mayor we hope the road will be improved, but this is the Caribbean at its sleepy best!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Incredible if you are prepared!!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren J
Reviews.Content: Take 5 minutes to check out the link to the website of the Tamarindo Estates. Very important information such as - make sure to buy groceries before coming, no food (either restaurant or grocery store) available within walking distance. I highly recommended that you rent a car or golf-cart from Carlos Jeep rentals would be extremely helpful. You could also call for taxi cabs who will drive you to town and playa flamenco for $5 per person. Our stay was absolutely magical. Can't wait to go back. Best snorkeling and private beach right there. Incredible. Comes highly recommended PROVIDED you make sure to read the website below and know what type of place you are booking. http://www.tamarindoestates.com/index.html

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: robinnit
Reviews.Content: The place was clean and well maintained. The view we had in # 302 was fantastic. The best snorkling we had on culebra was right down by the pool, which we also enjoyed. The cooking impliments were a little sparse and the air conditioner blew right on the bed making it impossible to sleep with it on, luckily we had a nice breeze and we were fine with it off. The owner lives 200 yards below the cottages and his yapping dog got a little anoying at times, he also had a bright light that ruined the beautiful moonlit nighttime view. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh â€¦ this is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: StarFisher_04863
Reviews.Content: I am so glad to see Tamarindo getting the reviews it deserves. This is a very special place - you wonâ€™t find anything else like it on Culebra. No wonder people return here year after year! This was our first time, but we will be back. When we arrived for a week in February, the place had been undergoing a process of rejuvenation. Everything was newly painted; repairs had been made; things looked fresh and clean. The new resident caretakers welcomed us and made us feel right at home. They were eager to accommodate our needs, and asked for our feedback. The atmosphere was friendly and relaxed. The three cottages on the â€œestateâ€� are spread out on a hillside facing Luis Pena Cay and the mountains of Puerto Rico beyond. It is a beautiful natural setting: quiet and peaceful. The sunsets and starry skies at night are spectacular. Each cottage has three units with (mostly) covered decks facing the water. The units are simple, but clean and adequate for two people. The covered deck is spacious and comfortable, with table, chairs and a charcoal grill. The bed is a standard double, and there is no hot water except in the shower, (which was not a problem for us, but something to be aware of). There are no cooking supplies provided (except coffee filters), but we found plenty of provisions at the local grocery stores and cooked most of our meals, with occasional forays out for dinner. The small freshwater pool down by the beach is a little oasis â€“ a place to relax, read and cool off after a day in the sun and saltwater. Although the beach at Tamarindo is rough coral, and getting into the water at low tide takes some practice (there is one good spot at the north end by the pool), the snorkeling is incredible. Green turtles feed in the eelgrass just off the beach, and a colorful variety of reef fish make their home in the coral. There are several other good snorkeling spots, notably Carlos Rosario, and the wonderful sandy beach at Flamenco, very near by. Tamarindo is not a resort and Culebra is not a resort island. For those like us, who avoid resorts and instead seek simple, unpretentious places to explore, swim, snorkel, walk, read and relax in beauty and tranquility, it was perfect! Thank you, Dennis and Gail, for your wonderful hospitality. Hope to see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Tamarindo Estates”
Reviews.Author: tmd5
Reviews.Content: Culebra is a quiet island, a place to relax, a place to enjoy sunshine, beaches, and snorkeling. We have enjoyed visiting Culebra eight times, staying at Tamarindo Estates the last six times. A special place to which we will surely return. Tamarindo Estates is a modest, well-maintained, gated refuge. The twelve house-keeping units are small but adequate---simple but clean. The kitchens are OK for breakfasts and lunches; we have not tried to cook dinners. The terraces provide spectacular views of sunsets and starry, night-time skies. The management is friendly and responsive to all requests. The Tamarindo Estates private waterfront is broken coral, not sand, and access to the water is difficult (enter at the north end), but once in one finds wonderful snorkeling (turn south, left, along the outer edge of the coral heads). A quarter-mile walk distant is Tamarindo Beach, which provides sand and easy access for less spectacular snorkeling. Difficult to reach Carlos Rosario Beach may offer snorkeling better or equal to that at Tamarindo Estates, but there is no other equal on the island or perhaps elsewhere in the Caribbean. Also on the Tamarindo Estates waterfront is a small, well-maintained, fresh-water swimming pool. A Jeep is essential on Culebra. We have rented from Carlos. Three colmados in town provide adequate grocery selections. Restaurants change from year to year, with Mamacitas, Dinghy Dock, and Barbara Rosaâ€™s perennial and enduring favorites. Flamenco Beach is spectacular. It is crowded on weekends, as is much of the island, which makes one appreciate even more the privacy of Tamarindo Estates. We have stayed on Belize, Bonaire, Saint Vincent, and Puerto Ricoâ€™s big island. Culebra tops all, and Tamarindo Estates is in our opinion the best place to stay on Culebra.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Marty B
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to get away from it all -- to rest, read, swim, snorkel, snooze, gaze at the great view. The facilities were basic but clean and solid, the resident managers and the owner are friendly, and you've got a snorkeling beach and a lovely pool on the property and a combo snorkeling/swimming beach within an easy walk. Be sure to bring provisions, including soap, shampoo and food. (Unfortunately, the fruit available on the island is limited and pretty awful, except at a once weekly farmers' market.) The town itself is either humble or unimpressive, depending on your point of view, but there are some good places to eat: I'd rate Susie's, Club Seabourne, El Eden, and Zacos Tacos as by far the best. As for beaches, perhaps the most lovely is at the other end of the island: Zoni Beach, where you can really escape. It's worth renting a Jeep to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us, but probably not everyone”
Reviews.Author: Vinceduck
Reviews.Content: My wife & I had our second stay in February & will return in April...Hillside units looking West make for great sunsets on the covered porch. The bedroom & L/R are rather small, but adequate for a couple. Tamarindo Estates are indeed a private paradise. Great snorkeling & a private pool are a ten minute walk down the hill. We love it & the owner & staff are top notch. You will need to rent a jeep in town, or make arrangements with a taxi driver to pick you up. {inexpensive]

Reviews.Title: “lived up to and surpassed recommendations from friends!”
Reviews.Author: dslicht
Reviews.Content: Paradise! Great and very peaceful location. Amazing view and snorkeling from the private coral beach- I saw two sea turtles and amazing corals. Apartment had basic comforts with kitchenette. The appliances are basic, but you will find them adequate. It is our first stay here with our 12 year old daughter. The managers are very helpful, friendly and welcoming! We were generally impressed by the property. Everything very peaceful and clean. There is also a private swimming pool . You have the best view ever!!! There is a pc and Wi-fi you can use for free. Hot showers, ac and all other amenities. Everybody in Culebra was very friendly. The Isand in general is clean and safe. The many beautiful roosters running wild are a pleasant funny touch! There are no big hotels, upscale groceries and there are only a few main roads. if you want to get around at all and have a good budget you have to rent a Jeep from Carlos--Robert is the best! You could rent bikes and do the island in a few hours of serious biking--some very steep and rough dirt roads!. Overall, Isla Culebra or Snake Island is a jewel with amazing beaches, incredible views...A tropical vacation paradise! I highly recommend this place. We will try to come back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time Ever !!!”
Reviews.Author: natalia l
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed by the property. Everything very peaceful and clean. The owner is most helpful and his employees as well. Everybody is bilingual. Excellent location. snorkel beach and private sandy beach There is also a private swimming pool . You have the best view ever !!! Plus you will wake up to the rooster's call. Wi-fi. There is a pc you can use for free. Hot showers, ac and all other amenities. Anything one needs, the very friendly personnel will cater to your needs. I highly recommend this place. I will try to come back as soon as possible. Paradise on Earth!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical tranquility above the Tamarindo shore”
Reviews.Author: Nick C
Reviews.Content: We just had our second stay here and love it for the radiant view, quiet ambiance, and basic comforts â€“ an oasis of calm in the tropics. The units are well maintained, with bedroom, bath, living room and a deckâ€“ with the bonus of a stove and fridge, as well as AC and TV in the bedroom. The shower with auxiliary heater is fine for the tropics â€“ no steam bath, but I take a couple of showers with exercise and coming out of the ocean. Outside there is a shower with unheated water for rinsing off the beach sand, a wonderful amenity. VIEW from the deck is a treat as you can see mainland PR in the distance; at night without urban clutter the stars and moon are wonderful. I like that we are on the hillside a few hundred meters away from the water; Iâ€™d rather walk a few minutes to snorkel, or enjoy the pool, than be on the water for lots of reasons ï�Š Trade winds keep the bedroom cool in the evening without the annoying hum of AC. Wonderful ambiance for a good night's sleep. You really want your own rental vehicle for a grocery run, dining out, and exploring other beaches. We so enjoyed a Jeep Wrangler Sport from Carlos Jeeps, low- mileage (3k miles), detailed to the point of Armorall on the tires â€“ weâ€™d rented light duty Japanese SUVs before in the Caribbean, but nothing beats a real JeepÂ®. While Tamarindo Estates had beautifully paved lanes, the public road to Tamarindo Beach has challenging wrinkles in it â€“ which frankly I enjoy negotiating! Not as rough as Antigua roads for example, but simply part of the fun of an island paradise. We snorkeled several of Culebraâ€™s wonderful beaches, and getting there is half the fun â€“ unless you are a wimp, in which case you should probably stick to Disney World. Tamarindo Estates was a good value, a fine place in the country, with nice staff- the whole experience leaves us with a happy glow.

Reviews.Title: “Tamarindo, a private cottage in a nature preserve”
Reviews.Author: ffredbishko
Reviews.Content: My wife Ellen and I recently stayed at Tamarindo Estates. First off, being in Culebra is like a trip back in time to a place where everything moves more slowly and every one is pleasant and helpful. Don't look for a lot of upscale groceries or great roads. You will find absolutely beautiful beaches, very good restaurants, beautiful scenery, and great snorkeling. Some of the best views and best snorkeling are at Tamarindo where there are three groups of either three or six units isolated from each other all with great view of 180 degrees. Tamerindo has its own private beach with some of the best snorkeling on the island. Jose, the owner, Gail and Dennis, the care takers, will do any thing they can to enhance the quality of your stay. The cottages are certainly as nice as the beach cottages we have stayed at on Sanibel Island. The water pressure is a little low, but this is not objectionable. We would and will return to Culebra and Tamarindo. Free & Ellen Bishko

Reviews.Title: “Very simple peace of mind”
Reviews.Author: snapper113
Reviews.Content: This place is our little secret. So I am very hesitant to share our favorite spot. If you are the kind of person that wants the caviar to burst in your mouth in a precise moment, stop reading, go elsewhere. This is not Ritz Carlton style. The cottages are small and simple. You get a small bedroom and a kitchen with all utilities. The equipment is old, but clean and it works. It gets pretty hot in the summer and you need to run AC all the time you are inside. The AC is window type in the bedroom only. In winter nights are cool, so you generally do not need it. The unt is adequate for two and may be one child, no more than that. Although ther are 12 units, we rarely met more than a couple people at a time. The grounds are large. Practically all units have a beatiful view of the beach. You have to walk to the beach for 3-4 minutes. It is a private beach with great snorkelling that begins at less than a foot of water depth. It is all coral, there is no sand, lots of sea urchins, you have to be carefull. There is another beach within 5 minutes walk where you can always find turtles feeding on turtle grass. For sunbathing and swimming you can ride (5 minutes) or walk (25 minutes) to the Flamenko beach. Plenty of sand and coladas there. You can find light fare on Flamenko or go to the town for a restaurant. Alternatively you cook in your room. Tamarindo also has a small freswater pool next to the beach. It is surronded by the walls, very private and for most part you will be the only one there. The quiet and serenity is a trademark of the place, If you like simple and very relaxed vacation - this is for you. The groundkeepers there are very friendly and are ready to attend your needs and give you a nice advice. If you want to move around the island, it is best to rent a car. Taxi is easy to get during the day and is cheap, but forget about it if you want to go for a dinner. For SCUBA divers there is a SCUBA shop in town, but I have a mixed experience with it. As long as this place remains peaceful and quiet, we will be coming there again and again. If you decide to come too, please come in small numbers so that we preserve its beaty and serenty. Have a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne E
Reviews.Content: Our family has been staying at Tamarindo Estates during spring break for many years (five of the last six) and plan to return in March of 2012 again. The snorkeling off the private beach is fantastic and the reef contains an abundance of fish, and sharks and stingrays, I even saw an octopus last year! The cottages are simple but contain everything one needs. When I suggested we go somewhere else this year, the kids said NO, this is home away from home! The view from the cottage at the top of the hill is simply fantastic. This is not for the traveller wanting pampering at every turn of the road, but for the person who appreciates the solitude, the view and excellent snorkeling

Reviews.Title: “We had our second honeymoon there”
Reviews.Author: jomvb
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, gorgeous view of Luis Pena Key and Puerto Rico. Close to everything and to Flamenco Beach. You can scuba there and kayak. Beautiful, secluded pool.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump. Keep looking.”
Reviews.Author: chachi69
Reviews.Content: I approached Culebra with the mindset that it would be a rustic, no-frills vacation. Even so, Tamarindo Estates was a shock. Itâ€™s like a welfare hotel apartment â€“ with a view. Iâ€™m assuming the cottages were originally built to house the plantation workers and therefore were probably never designed to be particularly nice. The owners apparently want to maintain the apartments in the same spirit, because our apartment was beat up, run down, and shabby all over. Just setting foot in the place I knew I had made a huge mistake, and when the property manager pointed to the shower and said, "the stronger you run the water, the colder it gets,â€� that confirmed it. The soft, saggy, full-sized bed and both pillows are sealed in plastic bags, which you will feel and hear just beneath the thin sheets all night long. The hot water spigots in the kitchen and bathroom sink did not run at all, just like in many a public restroom. The shower head â€“ youâ€™ve got to see the picture I uploaded â€“ appeared to have an electric water heater the size of a tea kettle attached to it, which was the only source of hot water in the apartment. As you can imagine, it didnâ€™t go very far. Thereâ€™s so much more I could say but pictures say it all. I encourage you to look at them. Bottom line: the point of a Culebra vacation is to enjoy the outdoor beauty and attractions, not hole up in your hotel room. Nevertheless, at some point you need to come home, kick your feet up, and refresh yourself. If you stay at Tamarindo Estates you wonâ€™t want to come home, when you get there you wonâ€™t want to stay there, and you will feel neither clean nor refreshed from that sorry stream of barely warm shower water. The rate was around a $140/night, which is way too much for this tenement by the sea. There aren't many options in Culebra so take my advice: Club Seabourne is the best bet in town. Book early!

Reviews.Title: “Simple”
Reviews.Author: hamlet20
Reviews.Content: Nice & simple. GREAT snorkeling. Good to be away from town. Stayed on second floor. Good balcony & view. Quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: slitelysassy
Reviews.Content: Tamarindo Estates is a beautiful property with very cute villas. The villas were extremely clean and well-equipped with everything we needed to be comfortable. From the porch you have amazing views of the ocean and surrounding islands. The private beaches at Tamarindo were easy to get to and very clean. Jose and Luis were very friendly and helpful. This is an excellent place to stay for any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, wish I could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: chrisep
Reviews.Content: Nice folks, treated us more like family than strangers. The view from our little place was beautiful. Everything was clean and the inn keepers were a wealth of information. The pool was clean and in good condition. No noisy parties or loud music. This is definitely a place you can take the entire family. Flamingo Beach (listed as 1 of the top 10 most beautiful beaches in the world) was not far away. The beach at the inn was also very nice. Snorkeling was great right there. We ate at Momacitas one night and it was great! All of the locals were very nice about where the good fish finds were. We bought huge lobsters for just a few bucks. A lobster like that would have cost at least 100 at home. I think we paid 15. Anyway, if you are looking for a nice quiet place I would definitely check this place out. And yes, there are wild chickens everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Tamarindo Estates”
Reviews.Author: granite78
Reviews.Content: We spent three days in Culebra and stayed at Tamarindo. The view from our deck was fabulous and we could walk to some of the best snorkeling on the island. Managers/Hosts John and Karen were simply wonderful, making our stay very special. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely quiet location overlooking the Caribbean with spotless comfortable bungalows!”
Reviews.Author: UpstateNYNalli
Reviews.Content: We did not make our original reservations at Tamarindo Estates, believing that we wanted to be closer to Flamanco Beach, however, when we arrived at our beach "villa" we were VERY disappointed. Karen at Tamarindo Estates facilitated the move to one of the comfortable clean Tamarindo bungalows, gave advice about everything we needed to know during our stay, and generally helped us to have a very enjoyable visit in Culebra! A short walk took us to the lovely pool area and beach where we went snorkeling. A lovely swimming beach was a short drive (or walk) away. Awakening each morning (often with help from the roosters and chickens which became pets) to the view of the ocean was a delight and something I will miss until the next visit! Queen sized beds, shelves in the bathroom, and the ability to have a second bedroom without doubling the price would be nice additions!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I'd read these reviews before choosing Tamarindo Estates...”
Reviews.Author: JAS0126
Reviews.Content: We loved Culebra and would go back in a heartbeat. The Tamarindo Estates website's photos and descriptions were misleading. Our "cottage" was part of a six unit dwelling. We had two connecting units to accomodate our family of four. The units reminded me of Manhattan real estate: tiny and cramped. The kitchen and living room were the same space and literally five feet wide by 15 or so feet long. In addition each unit had a bedroom and a cramped bathroom. Very uncomfortable beds and furniture. We could hear our upstairs neighbor make dinner and another neighbor's baby crying. Alot. The management was helpful and pleasant, but mostly we felt ripped off. It was bad enough that we seriously considered leaving the day we arrived. Nice pool and glorious beach - after you hike 1/2 mile or so down the hill and back up again. Met several other guests at the pool who also felt diappointed by their accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent managers, beautiful, quiet place”
Reviews.Author: mastbury
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned to Milwaukee from Culebra. While on the island, we stayed at Tamarindo Estates. Tamarindo is a great place if you're looking for privacy, a great room with a kitchen, and really nice people. Karen and John (caretakers) took good care of us, and gave us all the information we needed to have a great time at the resort and in town. The rooms are clean and more than adequate. You're really paying for the private coral beach and stunning view. The beach is on a marine preserve- a channel that is relatively calm even in high winds. Tamarindo Estates has no restaurant, but town is an easy 7-minute drive away. Susie's has great seafood, Mamacita's is fun and also has pretty good food. All of the beaches on Culebra are beautiful. Culebra is a great place if you are looking for a quieter island experience, and Tamarindo Estates is a great place to rest, relax, snorkel, have a few drinks, and generally unwind. I like it so much I proposed to my fiance on the beach at Tamarindo Estates, under a full moon. Unbelievably beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful management”
Reviews.Author: bim1947
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, basic furniture, great views of the ocean from the porches and a very helpful management team (husband and wife, John and Karen). The apartments are scattered over a large private estate so you won't meet too many people. The town is very close and there are no shops nearby so definitely come with a car here. The place is generally quiet and the only people you see may be the residents of the small apartment next to yours. Tamarindo beach is around the corner, and Flamenco a mile away. We will definitely go back. Talk to Karen about where to eat in Culebra, how to get to the old helipad, and where to learn dominoes from the locals. She knows it all.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views!”
Reviews.Author: ann1010
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in Culebra and I loved it even more this go round. Tamarindo Estates was a big part of my incredibly wonderful vacation. From our balcony we had a trillion dollar view. It took my breath away...I didn't think a place this affordable would have such a magnificent view. My boyfriend and I bought charcoal and had a cookout one night under the stars with the ocean as our soundtrack...incredible. The cottage itself and the grounds were very well maintained. We had a few roosters and chickens, but none of them crowed and woke us up, which was nice. The managers that greeted us, Karen and John, a married couple, gave us such a nice, warm welcome, it was really great. Karen helped us with restaurants and beaches for snorkeling and how to get places....basically like having our very own travel guide. I would visit again just to say hey to them. I would suggest renting a car or scooter if you stay here because it's a little out of the way. That said, the island is so small that means 7 minutes from town instead of 4. I liked that it was a little secluded...even more relaxing. Overall, this place rocks and will only add to an awesome island and an incredible vacation.

Reviews.Title: “stay away from here”
Reviews.Author: rhodie2
Reviews.Content: Isolated. Poor beach access. Long walk to pool and all uphill return to only adequate housing. No restaurant. No effort made to make guests feel welcome , cared for or to accomodate any special needs. Incredibly poor services. I will never return to Tamarindo Cottages.

Reviews.Title: “Tamarindo Estates”
Reviews.Author: BSteele57
Reviews.Content: Got off the airplane and one of the hosts was at the airport to meet me with my rental jeep and keys to my bungalow. She gave me a map with all of the sites plainly marked as well as places to eat, shop, etc. I drove to the bungalow and found bottled water chilled in the "fridge" for me. The view was awesome! The air-conditioning in the room was frigid and the snorkeling some of the best I've seen. I met all of the hosts at the on property restaurant that night and we had a wonderful chat as I learned more about Culebra and the lifestyle there. I will definitly go back again and when I do, I'll stay with my friends at Tamarindo Estates. Louisville, Ky

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful island, horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmack98
Reviews.Content: This will be brief. Culebra is wonderful: the people, the beach, the weather, the food; yet our hotel -bungalow, cottage, shack- was horrific. It was isolated, poorly maintained, and expensive. My family and I will most assuredly be returning to Puerto Rico, but I will never put my foot on anything associated with Tamarindo.

Reviews.Title: “Private Casitas, Incredible Snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: Laurahfc
Reviews.Content: From the top of a hillside down to a coral-strewn beach and some of the best snorkeling in the Caribbean, Tamarindo Estates gives you everything you need in Culebra. The casitas are funky but comfortable--and most importantly they are air conditioned. Down by the water there's also a restaurant in season (not open in the summer) and a swimming pool. You'll take a long, rutted road to get to Tamarindo, but by then you'll be used to potholes and ditches since all the roads on Culebra could use a good coat of asphalt. Recommended for families, friends or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting place.”
Reviews.Author: Eunice711
Reviews.Content: We are from New York and traveled to Puerto Rico for a family reunion and decided to do it at Tamarindo Estates. Each little apartment kitchen had everything we needed from dishwashing soap in the kitchen, pots and pans, paper towels and the bathrooms were clean and wer also equiped with soap, shampoo and conditioner. Each small apartment has a balcony with tables and chairs. There is a shower outside to clean up before going to the apartment. There is a barbecue pit in front of the villas with tables. The place was clean and comfortable. The walk to the beach is a long one but once you get there the view is fabulous. The pool is a good size and the pool house is equipmed with bathrooms and shower. The beach house has tables and you can also barbecue there. The property manager was very helpful and was always there when we needed him. Adults and kids enjoyed the place. The best snorkling in the island is right in front of this property, we found out it is a natural reserve. The only problem we found is that you must bring your food supplies from the main island or be prepared to pay the prices of culebra. They do not have supermarkets but small stores. We found everything we needed but not always in the same place. Make sure that you rent a jeep (we did) or you will not be able to move around at wish. We did find that taxi drivers are easy to find and during off hours if you make previous arrangements they will pick you up and wait for you to take you back to the hotel. There are many restaurants in town. Recommendations: The most beautiful beach is Flamenco beach - a taxi ride away. You can walk it but there are no side walks and you can not always see the cars coming so we decided it was safer to drive there. There you will find kiosks with food and beverages. Make sure you get your ferry tickets early as they sold out fast and be on line at least an hour before if you are traveling with luggage. There is a car transport that works from Monday to Friday, if you want to take your car from the mainland a reservation is needed but it does not work on Saturday and Sundays. All and all we will do it again. If what you are looking is a quiet, peaceful place full of nature. This is it. We are ready to do it again..

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer2007
Reviews.Content: When it comes to Culebra there aren't too many options because it is a tiny island....however, I was not happy with Tamarindo Estates. They charge between 140 and 200 dollars a night for a tiny one bedroom suite...the air conditioning only works in the bedroom. which has a tiny full size bed..the mattress and pillows are covered in plastic covers. The bathrooms are old and at times moldy...they only offer you one bar of soap and a few rolls of toilet paper...no shampoo, no hair dryer. The living room area and kitchen is muggy because the a/c doesn't work there (who can even think about cooking when it's 90+ degrees?) And the absolute worst part about staying there is that there is zero customer service. There is no main office that stays open for a certain number of hours a day...no one is there to give you tips about the island...instead the management just wrote up a xerox copied manual of restaurants and car rental agencies in the area. They basically gave us the keys and said buh-bye you're on your own. If you like paying nearly 200 dollars for hands off service...go for it. If not I would SKIP the Tamarindo Estates...it is not worth the money and there are other accomodations on the island that cost the same but should be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: FancyDay
Reviews.Content: Like others here, I was pleasantly surprised by Tamarindo Estates. I expected the worst, and my expectations were happily exceeded. Five of us stayed in adjoining cabins for two nights in March. Luis, the property manager, could not have been nicer or more helpful. In addition to the basics of the cabins, he gave us tons of information about his favorite restaurants and beaches, snorkeling, and how to avoid injuries from fire coral. We enjoyed the small pool and the snorkeling right off Tamarindo's property. The snorkeling there was among the best we found on the island, and we had the water to ourselves each time. The small sandy beach is a 5-minute walk down the road. The cabins are extremely basic, but spotlessly clean. The bedrooms had ceiling fans and A/C, which we didn't even use all the time. There is satellite TV in the bedrooms. The kitchen had the essentials for cooking. Most of the units, especially upstairs, have beautiful views from the porches. Tamarindo Estates is a good choice for a secluded, self-catering choice in Culebra, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better (if not the best) places to stay in Culebra”
Reviews.Author: NyQueens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tamarindo estates 2 weeks ago. Since we spent a lot of time looking into the accommodations in Culebra, we are puzzled by the negative reviews of Tamarindo. There are 2 things to remember about accomodations on this quiet, rural island: 1) the options of where to stay are limited and 2) the typical resort type hotels are rare. Most decent places charge $200/night because they can. Culebra is for people who need peace and quiet, want to unwind and clear their mind at the beach, and can live in comfortable but not luxurious resort type hotels. Tamarindo Estates is efficiently and very well run. We stayed in a 1 bedroom cottage that was well kept, comfortable, very clean, and had a lovely deck facing the ocean. All the cottages at Tamarindo should afford great views. There is a lovely pool right on the ocean and you are steps away from Tamarindo beach. True, you will not be brought a stack of clean towels nor will your sheets be changed daily. There is no room service or a luxurious on site spa. However, all you have to do is make a quick call to request new linens, and towels. (There is apparently a restaurant on site, but we never used it). We cooked simple meals in our kitchen, which was well equipped. There was no oven, but a bbq grill with charcoal is provided on the deck on which you can grill to your heartâ€™s content. There are a few things that Tamarindo can easily upgrade that would improve the experience -- they could provide better bed sheets and linens, and use real and not tacky plastic flower arrangements. To us, these were minor issues given the lovely surroundings and views and pretty comfortable accommodations. (Another plus is that Tamarindo, because it is off the main road and not in town) seems to lack those famous roosters that people have complained about keeping them awake. However if you stay in town (see our review of Casita Linda, which we do not recommend, particularly for people in our 30-40 year old demographic) the roosters will keep you awake most of the night. A note on getting around the island -- unless you are an olympic cycler, you will need a car to get around. We had a good experience with Carlos Jeep Rentals.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away From this Place--Unless They Cut the Price in Half”
Reviews.Author: EricTraveling
Reviews.Content: Positives: Extraordinary view, of the open water, bay and beauty of Culebra, which is a tranquil little island about one hour by ferry from the east coast of Puerto Rico or 25 minutes by small plane, from San Juan. Also a peaceful spot. Very few people. Little noise. Negatives: This place is an insult. A rip off. A real bit of explotation. The problem is not with the natural setting. As I said above, it is beautiful. But for 200 a nite, you get a bed that is wrapped in plastic and that sags so much I got up and slept on the floor, the pillows also had some weird plastic wrap on them. The shower was like a spitting bit of rotting luke warm water. The bed room itself, had almost no windows, felt like you were in a hospital room. The living room, despite its position facing this extraordinary scene, had windows that you could not really open, the site itself is next door to a landfill. The management or staff---what managemnet or staff. You arrive. You pay in advance. That is the last you see of them. No restaurant. Not even a place to get coffee. No room cleaning service. They did not even offer to open the gate so the cab could bring our bags to the room. Or, of course, help carry our bags up the hill to our room. Sign the advance payment of your credit card and you no longer exist. Unless you check out more than 20 minutes late. As you will be automatically charged for another day. This place should shut down, get a new owner and try again. Better for now to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The view is magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller65
Reviews.Content: Tamarindo Estates consists of small cottages with amenities that include a small kitchen and sitting area. Since it is located on a 60 acre estate right next to the ocean, it makes for a fantastic view from the front porch. The website was deceiving though, because we expected the cottages to be right on the beach when in actuality they are located up a hill a few hundred yards from the beach with access only from the road. We were there during the week, and there did not seem to be any other guests, so it was very quiet. But I think that if the cottages were full, it would not be quiet at all because the cottages are located so close together. I was not too impressed with the rooms. There is an old window a/c unit in the bedroom that blew directly on the bed, so when it was on, it was freezing, but when it cut off, it got hot. The bedroom is in the back of the cottage, so opening the windows would have been warm. We were given 4 towels to start, and it seemed to be a problem to request clean ones when we had used the other ones at the beach. The beach at Tamarindo is reportedly best for snorkeling, certainly not a good beach for swimming or lounging. Flamenco beach (one of the world's top beaches) is located only 5 minutes down the road, so it is best to do your swimming there. Overall, if a view is all that matters to you, then Tamarindo Estates is the place to stay, but since the cost is more than other places in Culebra, I would have expected more from the accommodations. Nevertheless, Culebra is incredible and when you are there, all of the other stuff fades away.

Reviews.Title: “tranquillity and snorkelling”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Culebra is wonderful - there's absolutely nothing to do. Take a snorkel and lots of books to read. Tamarindo Estates is not cheap but it was perfect for us. Lovely view, well-equipped cottage (we didn't want to have to eat out). Every beach we went to we had entirely to ourselves (except Flamenco). We had the hotel pool to ourselves - where in the Caribbean could you expect that! Found lots of good snorkelling and came home completely relaxed. Lots of useful information on arrival from the manager, and then we were left to ourselves. Perfect. Don't go if you want someone else to entertain you. Do go if you want the Caribbean without the people.

Reviews.Title: “it wasn't great”
Reviews.Author: jujane
Reviews.Content: We went the first week of May of 2005. The caretakers were very friendly and helpful but the accomodations left much to be desired. The suite was stifling hot except for the bedroom so the only place to comfortably hang out was the bedroom. The furnishings were very drab and old-foam slivers for pillows, worn down towels, old sheets; it was my impression that not a dime of the profit went back into the the establishment. The beachchairs were old and, for the most part, broken and stained. All in all I found it to be a depressing place. Because Culebra is so small there's not alot to do at night except hang out in your room. Perhaps if the charge was far less I wouldn't have had reasonably high expectations. I wasn't looking for luxury but neither was I expecting drab and depressing.

Reviews.Title: “For the most part,wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: BobY1
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed Culebra and Tamarindo Estates.Very secluded and private.The main road to the hotel is now paved with easy access and lovely beaches.The snorkeling is nice,but not spectacular.The rooms are comfortable,but in the warmers months,not quite practical.We would have loved to have cooked in the kitchen,but only the bedrooms have A/C and are the only respite from the heat of the day.A/C to all areas of the units would be much nicer in addition to providing satellite TV to the living area to utilise that area better.The good news is there was a nice porch on our unit,(upstairs,overlooking the bay.Theres so much to see that the "bad" parts were small disapointments overall.In the cooler months,I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: chiroguy
Reviews.Content: This is a simple, nice place to stay on Culebra with the best snorkeling right off the coral beach. It is not the Ritz but if you are looking for luxury you are on the wrong island. Very helpful caretakers. Dont rent the cars as they are hazardous....go to Carlos Jeeps instead. Riccis was pretty good with nice sunset. The pool is very secluded and quiet as is the entire property. Five minutes from Flamenco beach and two miles from the airport. I would go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recommend this establishment to anyone that is looking to spend some time in paradise. We spent several days on the island of Culebra, and Tamarindo Estates is a near perfect place to stay if you are looking to unwind. The access roads have all been paved, so getting to the cabins is not at all a problem (some reviews mentioned that it was hard to get to from the road). They are only a minute or two from the main road, which also gives you access to the other beaches, restaurants and other needs that you may have. You get your own very clean and cozy living space with a spectacular view of the islands off of the mainland of Puerto Rico. There is also a nice little restaurant on the grounds, which is literally feet from the water. Bring a waterproof camera and gear from some great snorkeling right in that water. The staff is VERY friendly and helpful. They know quite a bit about the island as well, so take their advice about what to do and where to go. The people of Culebra are also very friendly. You will always be in good hands. If you want a getaway that is unforgettable, go to the great little island of Culebra, and stay at the Tamarindo Estates!

Reviews.Title: “Tamarindo Estates: Not bad, but get your car elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Tamarindo Estates is a nice property, but overpriced for what it offers. The rental cars that are optional with a room reservation are in poor condition at best (old, beat up, no AC) and, given the even worse condition of the road to get to the hotel, I would recommend renting from Carlos Jeep Rental or other (newer vehicles, AC, automatic transmission). The room would be well priced about $20-40 less per night, and the property would receive 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: elisar
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at Tamarindo Estates and had one of the best vacations ever! The villa was spotless, the staff helpful, friendly and charming, the jeep was perfect for our needs and the island of Culebra was alittle bit of heaven. We had a great time snorkeling, sunning, reading, hiking. The residents of the island were friendly and courteous. It was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great view; a little rustic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Culebra island, its beaches and snorkeling are as good as it gets. As you might expect, however, its infrastructure is minimalist. Bring as mcuh as you can (food, toiletries etc.)Tamarindo estates was ok. The best part of the TE was the view and a nearby restaurant (Ricki's). The unbelieveably bad part was the road entering the property. It is so destroyed or undeveloped that local taxi refuse to enter. If you like extreme dune buggy rides or mountain biking you'll love this road (unpassable unless you have a jeep). The staff was friendly. Videos and books are available. Brink plenty of mosquito repellant.

HotelInfo.Name: Tamarindo Estates Beach Cottages
HotelInfo.Address: PO Box 313, 00775, Puerto Rico
